AddToQuery

Returns the a string that is either $uri if you pass it or the current uri with the variable name $varName equal to the value urlencode($varVal) It replaces a current value if it find it or adds the variable and value pair if they are new.

Author
corey at eyewantmedia dot com on PHP.net
Parameters
string$varName
string$varVal
string$uri
Returns
string

static ChangeQuery (   $action,
  $var = null,
  $uri = null 
)
static

Edit the Query portion of an url

Author
greg dot linton at gmail dot com
Parameters
string$actionethier a "+" or a "-" depending on what action you want to perform
mixed$vararray (+) or string (-)
string$urithe URL to use. if this is left out, it uses $current_url
Returns
string EXAMPLE $url = ChangeQuery("-","sort", $url); removes the "sort" variable from the URL string

  $dom = '',
  $fast = false 
)

if (!file_exists('cache/tlds/all.txt')) {// feel free to refresh by interval createTLD('cache/tlds/all.txt'); } echo '

';
foreach ($urls as $url) {
echo $url . ':' . var_export(getHost($url), true) . "\n";
}
echo $_SERVER['SERVER_NAME'] . ':' . var_export(getHost(), true) . "\n";
